name: Orange
summary: I'm wired and running on adrenaline
feelings: wired, jittery, activated, primed, charged, restless
description: When you're in the Orange zone, you're feeling wired and running on adrenaline.
science: In this zone, your brain is high in noradrenaline and dopamine. This high-arousal state makes you hyper-alert, sharpens your senses, and drives fast, impulsive action.
strategies: First, notice the heightened state without chasing it. Then, ask if this urgency is helpful or unhelpful. Finally, ground yourself with one slow, steady action.

name: Yellow
feelings: excited, enthusiastic, energetic, vibrant, joyful, playful
description: When you're in the Yellow zone, you're feeling excited and elevated inside.
science: In this zone, your brain is high in dopamine. This lights up your reward system, making emotions feel brighter, your focus sharper, and the world more engaging.
strategies: First, enjoy the buzz and let yourself feel alive. Then, notice whatâ€™s energising you and why it matters. Finally, channel that energy into something meaningful.

name: Lime
feelings: optimistic, hopeful, uplifted, encouraged, inspired, curious
description: When you're in the Lime zone, you're feeling optimistic and looking ahead.
science: In this zone, your brain is high in dopamine and serotonin. This blend supports forward-thinking, helping you imagine better outcomes and form new neural pathways.
strategies: First, soak in the hope and let it lift you. Then, picture the future taking shape in your mind. Finally, take one small step toward what you've imagined.

name: Green
feelings: glad, proud, assured, seen, heard, understood
description: When you're in the Green zone, you're feeling glad and emotionally balanced.
science: In this zone, your brain is high in serotonin. This supports pleasant emotions and steady connection, helping you feel grounded and secure in who you are.
strategies: First, let yourself feel steady and seen. Then, tune in to what's grounding you right now. Finally, offer that same attuned presence to someone else.

name: Mint
summary: I'm content and at ease with life
feelings: content, satisfied, fulfilled, comfortable, settled, relieved
description: When you're in the Mint zone, you're feeling content and at ease with life.
science: In this zone, your brain is high in serotonin and low in noradrenaline. This gentle mix activates the parasympathetic system, helping you savour the present moment.
strategies: First, enjoy the comfort and let it settle in. Then, notice one small thing you appreciate in this moment. Finally, carry that gratitude into whatever comes next.

name: Cyan
summary: I'm relaxed and my body is at rest
feelings: relaxed, calm, peaceful, tranquil, serene, chilled
description: When you're in the Cyan zone, you're feeling relaxed and your body is at rest.
science: In this zone, your brain is low in noradrenaline. This cues a rest-and-digest response, loosening your muscles and inviting a deep sense of somatic release.
strategies: First, breathe in the calm and let your body soften. Then, notice where tension has melted away. Finally, stay here a little longer than you think you need.

name: Azure
summary: I'm tired and running on empty
feelings: tired, drowsy, sleepy, weary, flat, meh
description: When you're in the Azure zone, you're feeling tired and running on empty.
science: In this zone, your brain is low in noradrenaline and dopamine. This slows both momentum and mental sharpness, leaving you foggy, drained, and somewhat lethargic.
strategies: First, notice the weariness and let it be there. Then, ask yourself what kind of reset your body needs. Finally, give yourself permission to pause, recover, or sleep.

name: Blue
summary: I'm sad and weighed down inside
feelings: sad, gloomy, heavy, low, lonely, down
description: When you're in the Blue zone, you're feeling sad and weighed down inside.
science: In this zone, your brain is low in dopamine. This dims your capacity to feel joy or interest, making everyday experiences feel dull and emotionally distant.
strategies: First, acknowledge the sadness without pushing it away. Then, gently name what feels heavy underneath. Finally, reach out to someone, even just to say you feel low.

name: Violet
summary: I'm discouraged and losing my way
feelings: discouraged, disappointed, defeated, hopeless, ashamed, embarrassed
description: When you're in the Violet zone, you're feeling discouraged and losing your way.
science: In this zone, your brain is low in dopamine and serotonin. This combination can amplify negativity bias, making it harder to reframe your thinking when things go wrong.
strategies: First, admit that life is feeling hard right now. Then, notice the story your mind is looping through. Finally, look for one small truth that gently shifts the spiral.

name: Plum
feelings: upset, uneasy, unsettled, vulnerable, hurt, neglected
description: When you're in the Plum zone, you're feeling upset and emotionally shaken.
science: In this zone, your brain is low in serotonin. This lowers emotional resilience and skews toward unpleasant feelings, leaving you more sensitive and unsettled.
strategies: First, name what's upsetting you with self-compassion. Then, notice which part of you feels most tender. Finally, offer yourself the kindness you'd give a friend.

name: Maroon
feelings: overwhelmed, panicked, anxious, stressed, frustrated, uncomfortable
description: When you're in the Maroon zone, you're feeling overwhelmed and at capacity.
science: In this zone, your brain is low in serotonin and high in noradrenaline. This sharp imbalance activates the sympathetic system, triggering cortisol and putting you on edge.
strategies: First, recognise that you've hit your limit. Then, name what's tipping you into overload. Finally, slow your breathing and focus on the next smallest step.

name: Red
summary: I'm mad and my body is fired up
feelings: mad, angry, irritated, annoyed, offended, tense
description: When you're in the Red zone, you're feeling mad and your body is fired up.
science: In this zone, your brain is high in noradrenaline. This triggers a fight-or-flight response, tightening your body and fuelling a heightened state of raw defensiveness.
strategies: First, feel the emotional heat without judging it. Then, name the boundary that feels crossed or threatened. Finally, release the tension in a constructive way.
